name: therefrom
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
from that or from there; from a thing or place that has been previously mentioned: If the capital sum is £1 million, the income derived therefrom may be £20,000 a year. The moment I saw the room and the view therefrom no questions came to my mind but to take it.
More examplesFewer examplesThe auditor should obtain relevant and reliable audit evidence sufficient to enable him to draw reasonable conclusions therefrom. Next come the references to alcoholism and recovery therefrom.It is important to ascertain the source of overseas receipts to ascertain how income derived therefrom is to be taxed.
